oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A methodology for determining thermal properties of rocks
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KRISHNAIAH, S
SINGH, DN
JADHAV, GN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: transmission
temperature
thermal diffusivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The migration of heat in porous media has attracted attention of the research fraternity, since almost a century. Studies conducted in the past reveal that heat migration in a medium primarily depends on its thermal resistivity (defined as the ability of the material to resist heat flow in it), its specific heat (defined as the ability of the material to store heat) and thermal diffusivity (which combines the transmission and storage properties of the material and is an indicative of the rate of change of temperature within the material).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: International Journal of Rock Mechanics and Mining Sciences 41(5), 877-882
